column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=When
#Text=I was in Colombia , I got to watch an eradication mission of coca and poppy fields down in Colombia .
#Text=I also got to work on other cases .
#Text=There was a new tribes and missionary case that I worked on where there were three men who were abducted by the FARC , and there was no proof of life , and they just basically disappeared .
#Text=And I was able to work with the families and others in leadership within the FBI to bring that whole issue to closure .
#Text=They eventually declared the missionaries as being killed by the FARC .
#Text=But as you can imagine , it was one of those things where the family was in limbo and they just did not know and nobody was trying to find out for them .
#Text=It was a great honor to work as a staff member for Congressman Burton .

#Text=Probably one of the most thankful points in my time for him was when I helped write , or helped ghost write , the resolution honoring the life of Mother Theresa , which was adopted by the Congress .
#Text=You all probably do n't remember , but Mother Theresa died right around the time that Princess Diana died and all of the news coverage at the time was dedicated towards Princess Diana .
#Text=And Mother Theresa is arguably somebody that had lived more of a Christ-like life than anybody , since Jesus Christ .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Thompson : Okay one last question from me .
#Text=What was your father and mother 's relationship with former congressman Dan Burton ?
#Text=MD :
#Text=They went to high school together and knew him from their time in high school .
#Text=And my mother specifically was involved with the Young Republicans when Congressman Burton was involved with the Young Republicans .
#Text=And they all kind of grew up in politics together .
#Text=And then she later became a volunteer for his campaign .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Jordan Mornout :
#Text=You ended up losing your first campaign when you sought the nomination for Indiana 's Secretary of State in 2002 .
#Text=Of course , your opponents that year were impressive , but can you tell us from your perspective about the dramatic finish to that nomination ?
#Text=MD : That is a very sore subject with me , but it 's not as sore as it used to be .
#Text=It 's interesting because you guys really ...

#Text=I was kind of surprised with the capturing of the whole flyer deal on the floor , which misled the convention to think that I had willingly dropped out of the race , and my strategy was to win it on the second ballot .
#Text=I was everybody 's second choice .
#Text=The people that were supporting Todd Rokita were supporting him because of their relationship with Sue Anne Gilroy , and they would support me if Todd was not in the race .
#Text=The people that were supporting Richard Mourdock were supporting him because he was older and had more experience than I had .
#Text=But they liked me after they got to know me , and I was their second choice .
